1//
2// Created by tibo and paola on 21/02/18.

5#include <iostream>
6
7#include <boost/program_options.hpp>
8namespace po = boost::program_options;
9
10#include "libdecklink/types.hpp"
11#include "libdecklink/device.hpp"
12#include "libdecklink/video_output_frame.hpp"
13
14#include "handle_errors.hpp"
15
16// Disable a bunch of warnings in stb_image.h
17#pragma GCC diagnostic push
18#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion"
19#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-conversion"
20#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdouble-promotion"
21#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wconstant-conversion"
22#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wunused-parameter"
23
24#define STB_IMAGE_IMPLEMENTATION
25#include "stb_image.h"
26
27#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
28
29// TODO: proper program options
30
31using namespace DeckLink;
32
33struct Image {
34 int width = -1, height = -1, depth = -1;
35 unsigned char *data = nullptr;
36};
37
38void show_usage(po::options_description opts) {
39 std::cout << "deckoutput [--list | --device :device-name: | --image-format :format: | \n"
40 << " --source :image-file: ]\n"
41 << "\n"
42 << "Write the test image to the specified DeckLink device.\n"
43 << "\n"
44 << "USAGE"
45 << opts << " \n";
46}
47
48int main(int argc, char **argv) {
49
50 po::positional_options_description positional_opts;
51 positional_opts.add("device", 1);
52
53 po::options_description main_opts("Options");
54 main_opts.add_options()
55 ("help", "Show this help.")
56 (
57 "list,l",
58 po::bool_switch(),
59 "The configuration file to use. See the README for more information"
60 ) (
61 "device,d",
62 po::value<std::string>(),
63 "The file in which to save the intrinsic camera calibration parameters"
64 ) (
65 "image-format,i",
66 po::value<std::string>(),
67 "The image format to use when outputting the image. See `deckquery` for a complete list "
68 ) (
69 "source-image,s",
70 po::value<std::string>(),
71 "The image to output to the device"
72 );
73
74 po::variables_map cmdline;
75 try {
76 auto parsed_opts = po::command_line_parser(argc, argv)
77 .options(main_opts)
78 .positional(positional_opts)
79 .run();
80
81 po::store(parsed_opts, cmdline);
82 if (cmdline.count("help")) {
83 std::cout << main_opts << std::endl;
84 exit(-1);
85 }
86
87 po::notify(cmdline);
88 } catch (po::required_option& ex) {
89 std::cerr << "Error: required option \"" << ex.get_option_name()
90 << "\" missing from command line arguments" << std::endl;
91
92 show_usage(main_opts);
93 exit(-1);
94 } catch (po::unknown_option &ex) {
95 std::cerr << "Error: unknown option \"" << ex.get_option_name() << "\"\n" << main_opts
96 << std::endl;
97
98 show_usage(main_opts);
99 exit(-1);
100 }
101
102 try {
103 if (cmdline["list"].as<bool>()) {
104 const auto devices = Device::List();
105
106 std::cout << "Listing detected devices:\n";
107 for (const auto &device: devices) {
108 std::cout << " - " << device.get_display_name()
109 << " ( " << device.get_vendor_name()
110 << " " << device.get_model_name() << " )\n";
111 }
112 return 0;
113 }
114
115 if (!cmdline.count("device")) {
116 std::cerr << "If the <--list> option is not specified the <--device> option is mandatory.\n";
117 show_usage(main_opts);
118 exit(-1);
119 }
120
121 const std::string device_name = cmdline["device"].as<std::string>();
122 auto has_device = Device::Get(device_name);
123 if (!has_device) {
124 std::cerr << "Error: Unable to locate a device named: " << device_name << ".\n";
125 return -1;
126 }
127
128 auto &device = *has_device;
129
130 // check if the selected display mode is supported
131 DisplayMode display_mode;
132 const auto pixel_format = DeckLink::PixelFormat::BGRA_8Bit;
133
134 if (!cmdline.count("image-format")) {
135 const auto display_modes = device.output().get_all_supported_display_modes();
136 display_mode = display_modes.front();
137
138 std::cout << "No display mode specified. Using first supported display mode: "
139 << display_mode.get_name() << "\n";
140 } else {
141 const auto image_format = DeckLink::to_ImageFormat(cmdline["image-format"].as<std::string>());
142
143 const auto res = device.output().get_display_mode(image_format);
144 if (!res) {
145 std::cerr << "Image format \"" << to_string(image_format) << "\" is not "
146 << "supported by this device" << std::endl;
147 return -1;
148 }
149
150 display_mode = *res;
151 }
152
153 std::string source_image_file = "keyer_overlay.png";
154 if (cmdline.count("source-image")) {
155 source_image_file = cmdline["source-image"].as<std::string>();
156 }
157
158 device.output()
159 .enable(display_mode, PixelFormat::BGRA_8Bit, VideoOutputFlags::Default)
160 .enable_keyer()
161 .set_opacity(uint8_t(100));
162
163 Image source_image;
164 source_image.data = stbi_load(
165 source_image_file.c_str(),
166 &source_image.width,
167 &source_image.height,
168 &source_image.depth, 0
169 );
170
171 if (!source_image.data) {
172 BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION(runtime_error() << errmsg("Unable to load the overlaying image"));
173 };
174
175 // Make sure that the image we loaded is the right size for the format
176 if (source_image.depth != 4) {
177 BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION(runtime_error() << errmsg("Expected 4 channel (RGBA) image"));
178 }
179
180 if (source_image.width != display_mode.get_width()) {
181 BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION(runtime_error()
182 << errmsg("Invalid image size: width. For \"" + to_string(display_mode.get_image_format()) +"\" images"
183 + " width should be " + std::to_string(display_mode.get_width()) + " pixels"
184 )
185 );
186 }
187
188 if (source_image.height != display_mode.get_height()) {
189 BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION(runtime_error()
190 << errmsg("Invalid image size: height. For \"" + to_string(display_mode.get_image_format()) +"\" images"
191 + " height should be " + std::to_string(display_mode.get_height()) + " pixels"
192 )
193 );
194 }
195
196 auto frame = device.output().create_video_frame(display_mode, pixel_format);
197
198 frame.load(source_image.data, row_bytes(pixel_format, source_image.width) * source_image.height);
199 device.output()
200 .display_video_frame(frame);
201
202 char c;
203 while (true) {
204 std::cout << "Press 'q' to quit ..." << std::endl;
205 std::cin >> c;
206
207 if (c == 'q') break;
208 }
209
210 device.output().disable();
211
212 } catch (const DeckLink::decklink_driver_error &ex) {
213 print_driver_error_details(ex);
214
215 } catch (const DeckLink::runtime_error &ex) {
216 std::cout << "\n"
217 << "An error occurred! \n"
218 << boost::diagnostic_information(ex) << "\n";
219 }
220
221 return 0;
222
223}
DeckLink::BitMask

static std::vector< Device > List()
Definition device.cpp:14

void print_driver_error_details(const DeckLink::decklink_driver_error &ex)

Definition capture_callback.cpp:12

ImageFormat to_ImageFormat(const std::string &value)
Convert a std::string to a ImageFormat value.
Definition types.cpp:102
DeckLink::row_bytes
size_t row_bytes(PixelFormat pixel_format, int width)
Compute the length of bytes of a single image row.
Definition video_input_frame.cpp:61
DeckLink::PixelFormat::BGRA_8Bit
@ BGRA_8Bit
DeckLink::errmsg
boost::error_info< struct tag_errmsg, const std::string > errmsg
Definition errors.hpp:16
stb_image.h
stbi_load
STBIDEF stbi_uc * stbi_load(char const *filename, int *x, int *y, int *channels_in_file, int desired_channels)

Definition deckoutput.cpp:34

Convert a ImageFormat to a std::string.
Definition types.cpp:15
types.hpp
